channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: FinLangNet: A Novel Deep Learning Framework for Credit Risk Prediction Using Linguistic Analogy in Financial Data
item.description: Our research demonstrates that FinLangNet surpasses traditional statistical methods in predicting credit risk and that its integration with these methods enhances credit card fraud prediction models, achieving a significant improvement of over 1. 5 points in the Kolmogorov-Smirnov metric.

item.title: LLM-R2: A Large Language Model Enhanced Rule-based Rewrite System for Boosting Query Efficiency
item.description: In order to maintain equivalence between the rewritten query and the original one during rewriting, traditional query rewrite methods always rewrite the queries following certain rewrite rules.

item.title: MambaMOS: LiDAR-based 3D Moving Object Segmentation with Motion-aware State Space Model
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel LiDAR-based 3D Moving Object Segmentation with Motion-aware State Space Model, termed MambaMOS.

item.title: Scalable Data Assimilation with Message Passing
item.description: Data assimilation is a core component of numerical weather prediction systems.

item.title: Stronger Random Baselines for In-Context Learning
item.description: Evaluating the in-context learning classification performance of language models poses challenges due to small dataset sizes, extensive prompt-selection using the validation set, and intentionally difficult tasks that lead to near-random performance.

item.title: Unsupervised Domain Adaption Harnessing Vision-Language Pre-training
item.description: To address this, we propose a novel method called Cross-Modal Knowledge Distillation (CMKD), leveraging VLP models as teacher models to guide the learning process in the target domain, resulting in state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: Optimizing Calibration by Gaining Aware of Prediction Correctness
item.description: For example, for a narrow misclassification, a calibrator trained by the CE loss often produces high confidence on the wrongly predicted class (e. g., a test sample is wrongly classified and its softmax score on the ground truth class is around 0. 4), which is undesirable.

item.title: Continual Learning on a Diet: Learning from Sparsely Labeled Streams Under Constrained Computation
item.description: DietCL meticulously allocates computational budget for both types of data.

item.title: Bayesian Co-navigation: Dynamic Designing of the Materials Digital Twins via Active Learning
item.description: Hence, the integration of theory within automated and autonomous experimental setups, or theory in the loop automated experiment, is emerging as a crucial objective for accelerating scientific research.

item.title: FlagVNE: A Flexible and Generalizable Reinforcement Learning Framework for Network Resource Allocation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a FLexible And Generalizable RL framework for VNE, named FlagVNE.

item.title: Learning Stable and Passive Neural Differential Equations
item.description: We take a recently proposed Polyak Lojasiewicz network (PLNet) as an Lyapunov function and then parameterize the vector field as the descent directions of the Lyapunov function.

item.title: Training-and-prompt-free General Painterly Harmonization Using Image-wise Attention Sharing
item.description: To surmount these hurdles, we design a Training-and-prompt-Free General Painterly Harmonization method using image-wise attention sharing (TF-GPH), which integrates a novel "share-attention module".

item.title: Cross-cultural Inspiration Detection and Analysis in Real and LLM-generated Social Media Data
item.description: To this end, we compile and make publicly available the InspAIred dataset, which consists of 2, 000 real inspiring posts, 2, 000 real non-inspiring posts, and 2, 000 generated inspiring posts evenly distributed across India and the UK.

item.title: MoVA: Adapting Mixture of Vision Experts to Multimodal Context
item.description: Although some large-scale pretrained vision encoders such as vision encoders in CLIP and DINOv2 have brought promising performance, we found that there is still no single vision encoder that can dominate various image content understanding, e. g., the CLIP vision encoder leads to outstanding results on general image understanding but poor performance on document or chart content.

item.title: LaPA: Latent Prompt Assist Model For Medical Visual Question Answering
item.description: In this paper, we propose the Latent Prompt Assist model (LaPA) for medical visual question answering.

item.title: Disentangling ID and Modality Effects for Session-based Recommendation
item.description: At the item level, we introduce a co-occurrence representation schema to explicitly incorporate cooccurrence patterns into ID representations.

item.title: Grasper: A Generalist Pursuer for Pursuit-Evasion Problems
item.description: Pursuit-evasion games (PEGs) model interactions between a team of pursuers and an evader in graph-based environments such as urban street networks.

item.title: Adaptive Regularization of Representation Rank as an Implicit Constraint of Bellman Equation
item.description: We then leverage this upper bound to propose a novel regularizer, namely BEllman Equation-based automatic rank Regularizer (BEER).

item.title: Robust CLIP-Based Detector for Exposing Diffusion Model-Generated Images
item.description: Diffusion models (DMs) have revolutionized image generation, producing high-quality images with applications spanning various fields.

item.title: Auto-Formula: Recommend Formulas in Spreadsheets using Contrastive Learning for Table Representations
item.description: Spreadsheets are widely recognized as the most popular end-user programming tools, which blend the power of formula-based computation, with an intuitive table-based interface.

item.title: Sentiment-oriented Transformer-based Variational Autoencoder Network for Live Video Commenting
item.description: Furthermore, a batch attention module is also proposed in this paper to alleviate the problem of missing sentimental samples, caused by the data imbalance, which is common in live videos as the popularity of videos varies.

item.title: Dynamic Temperature Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Temperature plays a pivotal role in moderating label softness in the realm of knowledge distillation (KD).

item.title: MAexp: A Generic Platform for RL-based Multi-Agent Exploration
item.description: The sim-to-real gap poses a significant challenge in RL-based multi-agent exploration due to scene quantization and action discretization.

item.title: Generalized Few-Shot Meets Remote Sensing: Discovering Novel Classes in Land Cover Mapping via Hybrid Semantic Segmentation Framework
item.description: Land-cover mapping is one of the vital applications in Earth observation, aiming at classifying each pixel's land-cover type of remote-sensing images.

item.title: Cooperative Sentiment Agents for Multimodal Sentiment Analysis
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new Multimodal Representation Learning (MRL) method for Multimodal Sentiment Analysis (MSA), which facilitates the adaptive interaction between modalities through Cooperative Sentiment Agents, named Co-SA.

item.title: SA-Attack: Speed-adaptive stealthy adversarial attack on trajectory prediction
item.description: This method searches the sensitive region of trajectory prediction models and generates the adversarial trajectories by using the vehicle-following method and incorporating information about forthcoming trajectories.

item.title: Rethinking the Evaluation of Dialogue Systems: Effects of User Feedback on Crowdworkers and LLMs
item.description: Workers are more susceptible to user feedback on usefulness and interestingness compared to LLMs on interestingness and relevance.

item.title: COIN: Counterfactual inpainting for weakly supervised semantic segmentation for medical images
item.description: This evidence suggests that COIN is a promising approach for semantic segmentation of tumors in CT images, and presents a step forward in making deep learning applications more accessible and effective in healthcare, where annotated data is scarce.

item.title: Integer Programming for Learning Directed Acyclic Graphs from Non-identifiable Gaussian Models
item.description: We study the problem of learning directed acyclic graphs from continuous observational data, generated according to a linear Gaussian structural equation model.

item.title: A visualization method for data domain changes in CNN networks and the optimization method for selecting thresholds in classification tasks
item.description: In recent years, Face Anti-Spoofing (FAS) has played a crucial role in preserving the security of face recognition technology.

item.title: Pre-trained Vision-Language Models Learn Discoverable Visual Concepts
item.description: Do vision-language models (VLMs) pre-trained to caption an image of a "durian" learn visual concepts such as "brown" (color) and "spiky" (texture) at the same time?

item.title: Sample Design Engineering: An Empirical Study of What Makes Good Downstream Fine-Tuning Samples for LLMs
item.description: In the burgeoning field of Large Language Models (LLMs) like ChatGPT and LLaMA, Prompt Engineering (PE) is renowned for boosting zero-shot or in-context learning (ICL) through prompt modifications.

item.title: decoupleQ: Towards 2-bit Post-Training Uniform Quantization via decoupling Parameters into Integer and Floating Points
item.description: However, existing quantization schemes suffer from significant accuracy degradation at very low bits, or require some additional computational overhead when deployed, making it difficult to be applied to large-scale applications in industry.

item.title: Dubo-SQL: Diverse Retrieval-Augmented Generation and Fine Tuning for Text-to-SQL
item.description: We introduce two new methods, Dubo-SQL v1 and v2.

item.title: Efficient Learning of Fuzzy Logic Systems for Large-Scale Data Using Deep Learning
item.description: Type-1 and Interval Type-2 (IT2) Fuzzy Logic Systems (FLS) excel in handling uncertainty alongside their parsimonious rule-based structure.

item.title: Evaluating Character Understanding of Large Language Models via Character Profiling from Fictional Works
item.description: These results strongly validate the character understanding capability of LLMs.

item.title: Characterizing LLM Abstention Behavior in Science QA with Context Perturbations
item.description: The correct model response in the face of uncertainty is to abstain from answering a question so as not to mislead the user.

item.title: S3R-Net: A Single-Stage Approach to Self-Supervised Shadow Removal
item.description: In this paper we present S3R-Net, the Self-Supervised Shadow Removal Network.

item.title: Grammatical Error Correction for Code-Switched Sentences by Learners of English
item.description: Through this exploration, we propose a novel method of generating synthetic CSW GEC datasets by translating different spans of text within existing GEC corpora.

item.title: Hypergraph Self-supervised Learning with Sampling-efficient Signals
item.description: Self-supervised learning (SSL) provides a promising alternative for representation learning on hypergraphs without costly labels.

item.title: Not All Voxels Are Equal: Hardness-Aware Semantic Scene Completion with Self-Distillation
item.description: Furthermore, the voxels in the boundary region are more challenging to differentiate than those in the interior.

item.title: MaskCD: A Remote Sensing Change Detection Network Based on Mask Classification
item.description: Change detection (CD) from remote sensing (RS) images using deep learning has been widely investigated in the literature.

item.title: X-Light: Cross-City Traffic Signal Control Using Transformer on Transformer as Meta Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learner
item.description: The effectiveness of traffic light control has been significantly improved by current reinforcement learning-based approaches via better cooperation among multiple traffic lights.

item.title: Towards a Foundation Model for Partial Differential Equations: Multi-Operator Learning and Extrapolation
item.description: More importantly, we provide three extrapolation studies to demonstrate that PROSE-PDE can generalize physical features through the robust training of multiple operators and that the proposed model can extrapolate to predict PDE solutions whose models or data were unseen during the training.

item.title: Sharing Parameter by Conjugation for Knowledge Graph Embeddings in Complex Space
item.description: A Knowledge Graph (KG) is the directed graphical representation of entities and relations in the real world.

item.title: LongEmbed: Extending Embedding Models for Long Context Retrieval
item.description: This paper explores context window extension of existing embedding models, pushing the limit to 32k without requiring additional training.

item.title: Information theory unifies atomistic machine learning, uncertainty quantification, and materials thermodynamics
item.description: An accurate description of information is relevant for a range of problems in atomistic modeling, such as sampling methods, detecting rare events, analyzing datasets, or performing uncertainty quantification (UQ) in machine learning (ML)-driven simulations.

item.title: Transformer tricks: Removing weights for skipless transformers
item.description: He and Hofmann (arXiv:2311. 01906) detailed a skipless transformer without the V and P (post-attention projection) linear layers, which reduces the total number of weights.

item.title: Exploring Boundaries and Intensities in Offensive and Hate Speech: Unveiling the Complex Spectrum of Social Media Discourse
item.description: The prevalence of digital media and evolving sociopolitical dynamics have significantly amplified the dissemination of hateful content.

item.title: Towards Large Language Models as Copilots for Theorem Proving in Lean
item.description: In this paper, we explore LLMs as copilots that assist humans in proving theorems.
